DataElement.preferredName: Arsenic Trioxide Agent Current Report Period Adminstered End Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date administration of arsenic trioxide  ended during the current report period.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Arsenic Trioxide Agent Current Report Period Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of arsenic trioxide, a small-molecule arsenic compound with antineoplastic activity that causes damage to or degradation of the promyelocytic leukemia protein/retinoic acid receptor-alpha (PML/RARa) fusion protein, during the current report period.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A small-molecule arsenic compound with antineoplastic activity.  The mechanism of action of arsenic trioxide is not completely understood. This agent causes damage to or degradation of the promyelocytic leukemia protein/retinoic acid receptor-alpha (PML/RARa) fusion protein; induces apoptosis in acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) cells and in many other tumor cell types; promotes cell differentiation and suppresses cell proliferation in many different tumor cell types; and is pro-angiogenic. (NCI04):An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A small-molecule arsenic compound with antineoplastic activity.  The mechanism of action of arsenic trioxide is not completely understood. This agent causes damage to or degradation of the promyelocytic leukemia protein/retinoic acid receptor-alpha (PML/RARa) fusion protein; induces apoptosis in acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) cells and in many other tumor cell types; promotes cell differentiation and suppresses cell proliferation in many different tumor cell types; and is pro-angiogenic. (NCI04)
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Report; a short account.:An interval of time. (NCI):Given.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation or an event ended.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
